titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 725: Fasciculus temporum

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Oversize Ms. Codex 725: Fasciculus temporum are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: Title and attribution supplied by cataloger (Zacour-Hirsch). Note in a later hand with the title Cronologia ab exordio mundi usque ad Sixtum Quartum (inside upper cover).
Paper is brittle, breaking at the edges of the leaves, some have been previously repaired.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: World and church history to the election of Pope Sixtus IV in 1471, with diagrams and drawings throughout the text.

supportDesc.extent: 40 leaves : 417 x 273 mm. bound to 429 x 286 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 40; [1-40]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in humanistic script by a single hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Illustrated with numerous drawings and diagrams in ink, with history laid out in linear diagrams, some illustrations colored by hand (for example, f. 3v, 4r, 6v, 9v, 11r, 16v).

binding.p: Contemporary stamped leather over wooden boards, rebacked.

origin.p: Written in Italy (Zacour-Hirsch), after 1471 (last date in manuscript, f. 40v).
